conclusion: Analyze the image to understand the thermodynamic process, focusing on volume, temperature, and work done.
Graph with volume (V) on vertical axis and temperature (T) on horizontal axis; states A, B, C; AB horizontal, BC extends over origin.
State A: temperature T0, volume V0, pressure pA = p0; work done A to B is 10 J.
Process A to B involves no change in volume, so work done is zero (W_AB = 0).
Process B to C involves change in volume, work done is 10 J.
First law of thermodynamics: ΔU = Q - W.
Internal energy change expressed as ΔU = p0 ΔV.
Given work done from B to C is 10 J, p0 ΔV = 10 J.
Heat added Q = ΔU + W = 10 J + 10 J = 20 J.
Heat absorbed by gas from A to B to C is 20 J.
